title: Lissandra's passive consumes Mana Band's free spell
body:
Not really a bug or a post about the balance of the rune or Lissandra, it just feels like a broken interaction to get jipped out of one of my free spells because both cooldowns were up at the same time.

This is my first time posting on this forum, and I didn't see like a general rune interaction thread but I guess if other people have bumped into things that they also feel just doesn't seem to be interacting correctly with the game, like stuff not going off, not counting/adding up right, bugs, etc. feel free to post them here as well.

Please don't change this interaction! Nobody is understanding that although it consumes both, it spends 0 mana while the full cost of the spell is returned along with the 8%. All other champs just get the spell refunded with the 8%. Yes, it does nothing when at full mana, but it gives Lissandra the unique ability to cast 3/4 abilities from almost 0 mana. 

Let's say I have 62 mana at level 6. I cast a Q and my mana increases to 185. I can then cast both E and R immediately. This is the cost (85) + 8% of my missing mana (38). If it worked the other way I would cast Q at 62 mana for free, then at most I can cast W which would be free and return (38) mana, allowing one more cast of an ability. At lower than 50 mana I couldn't cast anything immediately because manaflow does not allow a free spellcast, it allows for the cost of a regular cast to be refunded.

I believe the current interaction is the best for Lissandra. Consuming both may feel a little weird at full mana, but this allows Lissandra's otherwise passive and especially high mana costs to be used in a way unique to the champion.

Not the best passive, but just something I thought of after reading your comment.

At least the upside is that Lissandra probably wouldn't want that mastery anyway. The other two choices seem much better. The ultimate hat - because she relies heavily on her ultimate. And nullifying orb for some tough matchups against long-ranged mages.
Also, she might prefer to pick sorcery as her secondary path and dominion as primary, because the arcane comet is too easy to dodge. So you need to cc someone for it to land, and if you do, that means you're close enough to them to use those additional 2 spells/autos to proc electrocute. And if you pick sorcery as secondary, then trancendence is also probably better, because Liss likes a lot of cdr. And then you might also pick scorch for extra poke, waterwalking for roaming, or gathering storm for better late game (although the games are quite snowbally right now and late game is quite unlikely).
